steps: In a medium sized bowl, mix the flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
In a different bowl, cream together the softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar. It should form a combined slurry.
Beat the egg and vanilla into the butter-sugar mixture.
Mix the wet and dry ingredients until combined.
Add chocolate chips and mix well.
Roll the dough into 6 balls (or more for smaller cookies) and place on a plate. Press the balls slightly so they look more like disks
Refrigerate for at least 30 minutes (helps keep their shape while baking).
Preheat oven to 375Â°F. Line the baking tray with parchment paper.
Remove dough from fridge and move to the baking tray.

Bake in the oven for about 10 minutes, poke center of a cookie with a toothpick/fork test. The fork should be mostly clean (ignore chocolate); take the cookies out before they are fully cooked as they continue to cook as they cool.
Let them sit on the baking tray for 8 minutes before moving to a cooling rack.
